section.title: The Wedding
section.p: With each room of gold he had seen, the king grew more pleased with the millerâ€™s daughter. Soon, he decided to marry her, making her queen. The girl, now queen, lived in a grand palace, surrounded by the luxuries of royal life, and her father no longer needed to worry about his livelihood. She had done what seemed impossible, and life was peaceful for a time

section.title: The Birth of the Child
section.p: Years passed, and eventually, the queen gave birth to her first child, a beautiful baby who brought new joy and hope to the palace. She had nearly forgotten about the little man and the desperate promise she had made that night in the room of straw. Her world now was filled with the sweet joy of her child, and she believed the past was behind her.

image.alt: The queen celebrates her firstborn child.

section.title: Rumpelstiltskin Returns
section.p: But one evening, the little man appeared before her once again, emerging from the shadows with a wicked gleam in his eye mischievous smile. He had come to claim the payment she had promised him in exchange for his help. The queen was horrified, realizing that her own words from that night had sealed her fate. Desperate to keep her child, she begged the little man to release her from the promise, but he remained unmoved refused to change his mind, intent on taking what he believed was rightfully his.

image.alt: Rumpelstiltskin returns to claim the queen's firstborn.
